intro: Anguillaria parasitica, commonly known as the parasitic orchid, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a hemiparasitic species, meaning it derives some of its nutrients from a host plant while also performing photosynthesis. The plant produces showy, often fragrant flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its roots are specialized to attach to and extract nutrients from the roots of other plants. Due to its parasitic nature, it can negatively affect the growth and survival of its host species.
